poll_list.title: Inclusion Poll for MIP12c2-SP6 - LINK Collateral Onboarding - September 14, 2020

content.content: MIP12c2-SP6: LINK Collateral Onboarding Preamble MIP12c2-SP: 6 Title: Domain work requirements for onboarding the LINK collateral type Author(s): Niklas Kunkel (@NiklasKunkel) Contributors: Charles St.Louis (@CPSTL) Status: Formal Submission (FS) Date Proposed: 2020-09-09 Date ratified: <yyyy-mm-dd>  Specification Summary This proposal defines the documentation and work requirements for the onboarding of the LINK Collateral type to the Maker Protocol, explicitly highlighting the domain teams’ objectives and work requirements needed to get it implemented to the Maker Protocol. If this proposal is ratified, the LINK collateral type will be added to the Maker Protocol allowing anyone to lock LINK in a Maker Vault to generate Dai. Proposal Details This subproposal contains the domain work products required for the LINK collateral asset to be added to the Maker Protocol. More specifically, it includes the risk parameters, oracle solutions, and the necessarily smart contracts required for the successful onboarding of LINK.   Risk Domain Work: The risk domain team’s work contains the following risk assessment for the LINK collateral type:  [LINK] Risk Domain Team Assessment    Smart Contracts Domain Work: The smart contracts domain team’s work required to get LINK added to the Maker Protocol includes an assessment of the general and technical information about the LINK token, a risk summary, formal verification considerations, audits & related documentation, a contract logic summary, administrative addresses, and lastly a contract risk summary. The full assessment can be viewed below:  [LINK] ERC20 Token Smart Contract Domain Team Assessment    Oracles Domain Work: The oracles domain team’s work required to get LINK added to the Maker Protocol, includes making sure the oracle price feeds to support the new collateral type are prepared. The full assessment can be viewed below:  [LINK] Oracle Domain Team Assessment    Motivation The goal of this proposal is to provide transparency to the Maker Community as to what the domain teams’ (Risk, Smart Contracts, and Oracles) work consists of in order to successfully add the LINK collateral type to the Maker Protocol. Relevant Information  MIP6 MCD Application: Chainlink [LINK] Collateral Status Index
content.GPT-summary: The post is a formal submission proposing the onboarding of the LINK collateral type to the Maker Protocol. The proposal defines the documentation and work requirements for the onboarding, highlighting the objectives and work requirements needed to get it implemented. The post contains risk assessments, smart contract domain work, and oracles domain work. The goal of the proposal is to provide transparency to the Maker Community. The post may receive entirely positive feedback, constructive criticism, questions, or auditing and reviewing.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal
